<@U8BKM335X> has left the channel
Are you guys using ```{% if row.check_box_name %}``` to check if hubdb booleans are true? It’s throwing errors in the editor.
~i think i use it with a .value after `row.check_box_name.value`~ i lied, its just `row.check_box_name`
I’ll just deal with the IDE shade :slightly_smiling_face:

Anyone ever tried using two HubDB tables in tandem? Looking to use one to power a team member database and another for case studies. Would be nice to reference the team member responsible on the case studies.

I would put a column in the case study database for team member, which you could either fill with the row ID or just the team member's name (depending on if you care more about making it easy on the dev or easy on the content folks).
Then in the case study template, do something like `{% set author = hubdb_table_row(team_member_table_id, case_study.team_member_id) %}`
Or `{% set author = hubdb_table_rows(team_member_table_id, 'name=' ~ case_study.team_member_name|urlencode)[0] %}`
Thanks! I’ll try this out.
Foreign keys may be on the horizon as well :wink:
Oooh, fancy
